trans-unit.source: Represents a dialog box that allows the user to choose a type.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class prompts the user to browse a list of Windows Workflow Foundation and .NET Framework namespaces and their contained types and select a single type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog"></xref> class by using an <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref>, an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeFilterProvider"></xref>, and a string.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> from which the dialog obtains services.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeFilterProvider"></xref> from which to obtain type filtering services.
The name of the selected type.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog"></xref> class by using an <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref>, an <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeFilterProvider"></xref>, a string, and a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref> from which to obtain services.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeFilterProvider"></xref> from which to obtain type filtering services.
The name of the selected type.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.TypeProvider"></xref> that allows access local assemblies to load in the type browser dialog.
Gets the type selected by the user in the type browser dialog box.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> selected by the user in the type browser dialog box.
Gets the component to associate with the type browser dialog box.
If the property returns a valid value--anything other than a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)--the component is added to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>.
This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.

For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23ComponentModel%23ISite%23Component?displayProperty=fullName> always returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to bind to the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog"></xref>.
Gets the container to associate with the type browser dialog.

If <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23ComponentModel%23ISite%23Container> returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23ComponentModel%23ISite%23Component> has not bound an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>.
This method is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.

For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23ComponentModel%23ISite%23Container?displayProperty=fullName> always returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> to associate with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the type browser dialog is in design mode.
This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.

For <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23ComponentModel%23ISite%23DesignMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> always returns `true`.
`true` if <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog"></xref> is in design mode; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets name of the component associated with the type browser dialog.
This property is required because <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog> implements <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>.
The name of the component associated with the type browser dialog.
Retrieves the service object for the specified type.

If `serviceType` is of type <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ITypeProvider>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.TypeBrowserDialog.System%23IServiceProvider%23GetService%2A> returns a service object.
Otherwise, it returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of service object to retrieve.
A service object of type serviceType, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if there is no service object of type serviceType.
